nodes.text: Welcome back to class. I trust you used your spare time to improve your Rogue skills.
Herr O'Conner clearly used his skills and his wits to uncover the school thief. You have him to thank for the fact that this class will continue.
Herr O'Conner, would you care to tell the class what you discovered?
I waited in my room until I heard someone moving in the hallway in the early hours of the morning. I snuck out following the sound through the darkened hallways.
Then I saw it in the flickering light of fire. The thief was not human. It was covered with fur and had large, glowing eyes and long, sharp claws. It was a monster!
I set out a trap and hid behind some displays. As soon as I heard the snap of the trap, I jumped out and confronted it with the crimes!
Weren't you worried that the monster would eat your face off?
Not really. It's hard to be too afraid of something that steals stationery and the Headmaster's hat.
So I convinced the monster to return all the stolen stuff and promise not to steal from the school again.
How do we know if you are telling the truth? You could have been the thief all this time.
If I had been the thief, I'm sure that such a skilled Rogue as yourself could have caught me in the act and revealed my crimes. Then you would have been the hero instead of me.

options.text: Be Honest to Educate Your Classmates

nodes.text: For several nights, I had been tracking the noises using my Stealth skills and looking for clues as to where the thief was going with my Perception skills.
I discovered that he was using a concealed door that led to the inner reaches of the castle. Therefore, I set a trap near the door and ambushed the thief.
Who was it? Who was this thief? Was he one of us?
No, the thief was not a student at the school. It was a Kwirk!
A Kwirk? What's a Kwirk?
Kwirks are furry creatures with long, sharp claws who live in the walls and hidden places of the castle. That's how they managed to steal so many things.
Why were they stealing from the school?
The Kwirks decided to start a school of their own for other Kwirks, so they stole school supplies.
Vhy did they steal Headmaster's hat?
Since the Headmaster is the boss of the school and wore the hat all the time, the Kwirk leader wanted to wear the hat to show that he was the boss of the Kwirks.
So the plot twist in this mystery tale was that culprit of the school crimes wasn't a student - he was a teacher!

options.text: Be Snarky to Amuse Your Classmates

nodes.text: It turned out that the Thief that was terrorizing the entire school, making students quake in their beds and infuriating Mr. Terk, was only a Kwirk.
I was really motivated to solve this crime. It was very important to me to show that the Rogues were innocent of the thefts. Thus...
I had to work to find the Kwirk to prove that Terk was just a jerk.

options.text: Be Modest to Please Your Classmates

nodes.text: I just followed Master Gerhard's suggestions and used Rogue skills to find the thief. Then I used my cunning and charm to convince the thief to give back what he stole.
I had to prove to myself and everyone here that I was worthy of being in this class.
We are meeting today thanks to the efforts of Herr Kent to apprehend the thief and the recovery of the Headmaster's hat.
Herr Kent, would you care to comment upon your feat?

I just tracked down the noises in the night to the Hall of Heroes, where I found out that the thief was using a secret passageway there. When I confronted the thief, it was a simple matter of convincing him to return what he stole.
That was it? He just decided to stop thieving and return things because you said so?

I explained to him that if he kept thieving, eventually the Headmaster would shut down the school and the castle would be closed up. He didn't want that to happen, so he agreed to make amends for his crimes.
So who was this thief?
I made an agreement with him that I wouldn't reveal his identity if he returned everything. He lived up to his part of the bargain and I intend to live up to mine.
So there's a secret door in the Hall of Heroes?
I believe that Herr Kent has no need to answer that question. Find out for yourself.
So Kent caught a crook by roguish ruse. Does that mean he's the major con-kent-or for the Rogue of the Year?
It might be a quirk of fate if he does win the title.
Tomorrow's lesson will be on advanced climbing skills, so I suggest you brush up on your normal climbing this afternoon. You may also purchase a rope and grapnel for class.
Will we be demonstrating our rope and grapnel skills in tomorrow's class, sir? I'll be happy to bring my professional rope and grapnel with me.
Not everyone in this class is as skilled as you profess to be, Herr Sosi. I will give the others some opportunity to master the skill before I embarrass them.
I will forewarn you, in two days from now, we will have a quiz and a test on your lockpicking skills. I assume you have mastered that basic tool use art by now.
Entlassen.

nodes.name: Hero Me!
nodes.description: I got to be the hero by catching the Kwirk... kinda fun. Of course, the moment was ruined because we're going to have a test in two days on lock picking...

nodes.name: Thief Caught
nodes.description:
Kent caught the criminal and is now the big hero. And in other news, we got a test in two days on Lockpicks and stuff.

Oh, and I need to buy a rope and grapnel for class.
